item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (106 points | 13 comments)
2. New Junior Developers Can’t Actually Code (41 points | 28 comments)
3. Uchū – Color scheme for internet lovers (337 points | 142 comments)
4. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1335 points | 339 comments)
5. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (106 points | 129 comments)
6. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (173 points | 75 comments)
7. Show HN: Air traffic control radio and chill music for focus (129 points | 69 comments)
8. MySQL at Uber (25 points | 2 comments)
9. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (51 points | 52 comments)
10. Flea-Scope: $18 Source Available USB Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and More [pdf] (265 points | 92 comments)
11. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (62 points | 96 comments)
12. Anno 1800: Shadows of Beauty (15 points | discuss)
13. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (17 points | 5 comments)
14. I pulled data on 1378 restaurants from Google Maps to rank them in order (4 points | discuss)
15. IPv6 Is Hard (137 points | 220 comments)
16. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (38 points | 11 comments)
17. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (120 points | 87 comments)
18. Explaining my fast 6502 code generator (2023) (73 points | 13 comments)
19. Javier Milei backtracks on $4.4B memecoin after 'insiders' pocket $87M (119 points | 132 comments)
20. Gold Is Worth More in New York (57 points | 54 comments)
21. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (27 points | 3 comments)
22. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (40 points | 4 comments)
23. Half-Life 2 and Dishonored art lead Viktor Antonov has died (419 points | 85 comments)
24. Did the Windows 95 setup team forget that MS-DOS can do graphics? (56 points | 17 comments)
25. OpenVINO AI effects [denoising and transcription] for Audacity (120 points | 23 comments)
26. United States Power Outage Map (266 points | 128 comments)
27. The human mind is in a recession (33 points | 25 comments)
28. Physics Informed Neural Networks (17 points | 1 comment)
29. Root-inspired additive printing for fabricating robust conformal electronics (15 points | discuss)
30. Oklch in CSS: why we moved from RGB and HSL (2024) (43 points | 16 comments)
